00035 #ifndef __BKE_CDDERIVEDMESH_H__
00036 #define __BKE_CDDERIVEDMESH_H__
00037 
00038 #include "BKE_DerivedMesh.h"
00039 
00040 struct DerivedMesh;
00041 struct BMEditMesh;
00042 struct Mesh;
00043 struct Object;
00044 
00045 /* creates a new CDDerivedMesh */
00046 struct DerivedMesh *CDDM_new(int numVerts, int numEdges, int numFaces,
00047                              int numLoops, int numPolys);
00048 
00049 /*tests if a given DerivedMesh is a CDDM*/
00050 int CDDM_Check(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00051 
00052 /* creates a CDDerivedMesh from the given Mesh, this will reference the
00053  * original data in Mesh, but it is safe to apply vertex coordinates or
00054  * calculate normals as those functions will automatically create new
00055  * data to not overwrite the original */
00056 struct DerivedMesh *CDDM_from_mesh(struct Mesh *mesh, struct Object *ob);
00057 
00058 /* creates a CDDerivedMesh from the given BMEditMesh */
00059 DerivedMesh *CDDM_from_BMEditMesh(struct BMEditMesh *em, struct Mesh *me, int use_mdisps, int use_tessface);
00060 
00061 /* merge verts  */
00062 DerivedMesh *CDDM_merge_verts(DerivedMesh *dm, const int *vtargetmap);
00063 
00064 /* creates a CDDerivedMesh from the given curve object */
00065 struct DerivedMesh *CDDM_from_curve(struct Object *ob);
00066 
00067 /* creates a CDDerivedMesh from the given curve object and specified dispbase */
00068 /* useful for OrcoDM creation for curves with constructive modifiers */
00069 DerivedMesh *CDDM_from_curve_customDB(struct Object *ob, struct ListBase *dispbase);
00070 
00071 /* Copies the given DerivedMesh with verts, faces & edges stored as
00072  * custom element data.
00073  */
00074 struct DerivedMesh *CDDM_copy(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00075 struct DerivedMesh *CDDM_copy_from_tessface(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00076 
00077 /* creates a CDDerivedMesh with the same layer stack configuration as the
00078  * given DerivedMesh and containing the requested numbers of elements.
00079  * elements are initialized to all zeros
00080  */
00081 struct DerivedMesh *CDDM_from_template(struct DerivedMesh *source,
00082                                   int numVerts, int numEdges, int numFaces,
00083                                   int numLoops, int numPolys);
00084 
00085 /*converts mfaces to mpolys.  note things may break if there are not valid
00086  *medges surrounding each mface.
00087  */
00088 void CDDM_tessfaces_to_faces(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00089 
00090 /* applies vertex coordinates or normals to a CDDerivedMesh. if the MVert
00091  * layer is a referenced layer, it will be duplicate to not overwrite the
00092  * original
00093  */
00094 void CDDM_apply_vert_coords(struct DerivedMesh *cddm, float (*vertCoords)[3]);
00095 void CDDM_apply_vert_normals(struct DerivedMesh *cddm, short (*vertNormals)[3]);
00096 
00097 /* recalculates vertex and face normals for a CDDerivedMesh
00098  */
00099 void CDDM_calc_normals_mapping_ex(struct DerivedMesh *dm, const short only_face_normals);
00100 void CDDM_calc_normals_mapping(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00101 void CDDM_calc_normals(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00102 void CDDM_calc_normals_tessface(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00103 
00104 /* calculates edges for a CDDerivedMesh (from face data)
00105  * this completely replaces the current edge data in the DerivedMesh
00106  * builds edges from the tessellated face data.
00107  */
00108 void CDDM_calc_edges_tessface(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00109 
00110 /* same as CDDM_calc_edges_tessface only makes edges from ngon faces instead of tessellation
00111  * faces*/
00112 void CDDM_calc_edges(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00113 
00114 /* reconstitute face triangulation */
00115 void CDDM_recalc_tessellation(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00116 void CDDM_recalc_tessellation_ex(struct DerivedMesh *dm, const int do_face_nor_cpy);
00117 
00118 /* lowers the number of vertices/edges/faces in a CDDerivedMesh
00119  * the layer data stays the same size
00120  */
00121 void CDDM_lower_num_verts(struct DerivedMesh *dm, int numVerts);
00122 void CDDM_lower_num_edges(struct DerivedMesh *dm, int numEdges);
00123 void CDDM_lower_num_polys(struct DerivedMesh *dm, int numPolys);
00124 void CDDM_lower_num_tessfaces(DerivedMesh *dm, int numTessFaces);
00125 
00126 /* vertex/edge/face access functions
00127  * should always succeed if index is within bounds
00128  * note these return pointers - any change modifies the internals of the mesh
00129  */
00130 struct MVert *CDDM_get_vert(struct DerivedMesh *dm, int index);
00131 struct MEdge *CDDM_get_edge(struct DerivedMesh *dm, int index);
00132 struct MFace *CDDM_get_tessface(struct DerivedMesh *dm, int index);
00133 struct MLoop *CDDM_get_loop(struct DerivedMesh *dm, int index);
00134 struct MPoly *CDDM_get_poly(struct DerivedMesh *dm, int index);
00135 
00136 /* vertex/edge/face array access functions - return the array holding the
00137  * desired data
00138  * should always succeed
00139  * note these return pointers - any change modifies the internals of the mesh
00140  */
00141 struct MVert *CDDM_get_verts(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00142 struct MEdge *CDDM_get_edges(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00143 struct MFace *CDDM_get_tessfaces(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00144 struct MLoop *CDDM_get_loops(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00145 struct MPoly *CDDM_get_polys(struct DerivedMesh *dm);
00146 
00147 /* Assigns news m*** layers to the cddm.  Note that you must handle
00148  * freeing the old ones yourself.  Also you must ensure dm->num****Data
00149  * is correct.*/
00150 void CDDM_set_mvert(struct DerivedMesh *dm, struct MVert *mvert);
00151 void CDDM_set_medge(struct DerivedMesh *dm, struct MEdge *medge);
00152 void CDDM_set_mface(struct DerivedMesh *dm, struct MFace *mface);
00153 void CDDM_set_mloop(struct DerivedMesh *dm, struct MLoop *mloop);
00154 void CDDM_set_mpoly(struct DerivedMesh *dm, struct MPoly *mpoly);
00155 
00156 #endif
